benchmark_details.name: Cin´ easte: A Fine-grained Contextual Movie Question Answering Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: Cin´ easte is a comprehensive benchmark for long-form movie understanding, comprising 3,119 multiple-choice question-answer pairs derived from 1,805 scenes across 200 diverse movies, testing fine-grained contextual reasoning across five novel categories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a diagnostic benchmark for assessing the capacity of multi-modal large language models in fine-grained contextual understanding of long-form movie content.

data.source: Scenes from 200 English-language movies sourced from the YouTube channel MovieClips.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with a two-stage filtering process.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the percentage of correctly answered questions among all question-answer pairs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance in understanding complex, narrative-driven video content.
methodology.baseline_results: The top-performing model, GPT-4o, achieved an average accuracy of 75.89%.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated using automated filtering to ensure context dependency and factual correctness.
